channel.title: [RELEASE] ServerStatus-Open Source
channel.description:
This is a server-status page you can find a example on http://riku-base.com/server-status/ This aint a big release since it aint even close to being finished so it even doesnt have a version number :/.
just read the readme file for more information.
download: http://riku-base.com/server-status.rar

item.title: [RELEASE] ServerStatus-Open Source
item.dc:creator: @ThuGie ThuGie
item.description:
@ThuGie wrote:

well if everything is going as planned i’m moving to my own apartment this saturday.
the box with the internet modem etc should already be delivert at my neighbours i just need to pick it up.
after that i will have to setup everything like bed stuff and clean everything up after that i should have time to finish it :).
if you got something you wanna see added just post it ;).

currently:
cronjob = that you can check what servers are online at a static time.
admin page = a page where admin’s can remove/edit or make a server special.
317/377 check = a check that will check if the server is indeed a private server and not like a ftp/http etc server,
not sure if i also add 377 but we will see.
listing options = like only show online servers or list using name or host/port etc.
comments = i will comment every like of the code well almost everyline :p,
and sort the code so it wont hurt your eyes as much ;).

edit:
i just sorted the code a bit.
not done 100% and only the php.

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE] ServerStatus-Open Source
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I like the layout, but it looks like you need an admin page (to delete tubgirl.com for example) and to filter out certain ports (80, 21, 25)

Also it would be nice if you converted seconds into minutes in my opinion.

Also one more hint, for cronjob updating just call ‘php updatescript.php’

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE] ServerStatus-Open Source
item.dc:creator: @ThuGie ThuGie
item.description:
@ThuGie wrote:

Dont worry as i state in the readme this release wasnt really ment to happen just i wont have time to update it soon.
so i thought about releasing it now
next release will have comments and cronjob updating etc ;).
alot more just wait :).

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE] ServerStatus-Open Source
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“sdouble, post:2, topic:140694”]If I was to do this, I would have it load the list completely before checking the servers. Then check the servers in an invisible iframe and update the Status with javascript using innerHTML[/quote]Or atleast have an external script update it every so many minutes. Waiting for it to load is a pain in the ass.[br][size=1]Posted on: September 06, 2007, 12:11:13 AM[/size][hr]Yeah, I don’t know how you can code like that, haha.

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE] ServerStatus-Open Source
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

Even though it likely doesn’t matter to half the people that’ll use it, it is okay to space out and indent your code, especially statement blocks. PHP’s a free-form language, didn’t the material that taught you mention that?

Your source code hurts my eyes.

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE] ServerStatus-Open Source
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

If I was to do this, I would have it load the list completely before checking the servers. Then check the servers in an invisible iframe and update the Status with javascript using innerHTML

Read full topic
